title: Feedback. 16 things that were better in old client (my opinion)
body:
My feedback is based on lastest EUW Alpha version (0.11).
I really like new client and enjoy using it but there is a few things that I think need to be fixed or reimagined. First of all, I know - this is alpha.

**Lobby:**
1. Game mode selection is not obvious and a bit clunky. I highly prefer the old one (I mean tree-type menu with mode selection when you press Play button).
2. Comparing to old lobby there is lack of animations and no eye-candy at all. I mean initial screen where you can chat and invite your friends is so simple and not alive.
3. Role icons is terrible and unclean to read. Old ones are way better.

**Champion select:**
1. Chat window is too small. Old chat have more visible strings than new one.
2. If someone dodge then chat cleanup and I can't read logs or conversation from previous lobby anymore. This thing helps to do some target bans if you remember your last team intent picks and don't see them in your new team (they most likely in enemy team now).
3. There is no minimap in right-bottom corner. This map was a great tool to get info about what side of map you will play (Blue/Red). Also I used it to know which champions have picked by my teammates while browsing the web.
3a. You can't really know on what side of map you will play if you miss initial screen with map preview.
4. Now I can't choose my skin after locking in champion. I forced to wait until all 10 players will pick their champions. I can understand this because of graphics disign but this is really uncomfortable. With old client if I have 1st-3rd pick I used to lock it then choose my skin and then freely afk 1-2 minutes before game starts. Now I forced to sit while others picking.
5. I enjoy ban quotes but there is no other sounds that was used in old client. I think for clarity sound overlay in champion select should be the same.
6. Team sidebar with role, nickname and champion is unclear. What I mean: for now there is huge accent on player's role (big capsed text) and small text with nickname and champion name. In old client nickname was major thing. If someone write something in chat I see his nickname but it's a bit hard to know what role this guy have and why he ask me to change roles. I think nickname and role labels need to be swapped on sidebar. Otherwise add role in chat strings, for example _"RivenMain420 **(Jungle)**: LET ME TOP RIVEN OTP???"_.

**Postgame screen:**
1. Honor/report buttons is non-obvious.
2. I think everyone agree that "Damage dealt" graph is the most common thing that people check after game. For now to get this graph you need to click "Advanced info" button and then choose "Graphs" tab. I think better if clicking "Advanced Info" would show Graph view by default.
3. Also chat is too small. You know that after hard game this chat is the most juicy thing. It's hard to read now.

**Others:**
1. Mastery/Rune tab: I really think that ComboBox have very low usability level if it's usage rate is more than 1 /per session. I think dedicated buttons for every mastery/rune page way more comfortable to use. Imagine situation when you need to compare you pages: how many clicks you will need to do with ComboBox (new client) and with buttons (old client)?
2. Window resize is a great feature. However I would like to see more size presets. For example I have 1920x1080 screen so default 720p client is too small for me but I hate to use fullscreen windows. Something like 1440x900 would be awesome.
3. Friend list hint is lack of information. I don't see friends rank, mastery pts or queue etc.
4. Champion select/ban quotes should have separate volume slider. I don't know why but even if I set SFX and Music volume to 10% (like I always do) champion quotes are still way too loud like a thunder.

Thank you for reading I think this feedback will be useful! Also english is not my first or even second language, sorry for this.

So, if it's covering anything, it just goes away.
I also would like for the friend's list to be somewhat retractable. Idk, to me it seems to be in the way.

Alpha client is more professional a client than a gamers choice, we need 3d stuff not 2d.I want to go wow at first sight.Please don`t take the candy from the baby.I think we deserve more, we buy advanced systems because we need more , we tweak those graphics to max because we love maxed out, provide a waterfall not a lake, still great job, just shake things up a bit. champ selection is kind of slow, i just got the 5 minutes wait for failing to pick a champ in time, the background pictures of the champions when selecting a champ are awesome, background music and  fx sounds do not mix well.

-I agree with **almost **everything he (Emestie) said

- Play: So in the new client, when you are choosing what game mode, map, co-op, other, it  does not seem consise; in that i don't think the layout is... simple for lack of a better word. For example, you have to go to another window entirely to choose ranked, draft, or blind. In the old client, they were all in a line, in a flow chart sense, which meant you could open the client and, with relative ease and speed, you could be in a queue waiting to play.

-The friend list: I do not think that it should be open all the time (un-shrinkable), mainly because some people, i don't know the numbers, probably do not have friends on lol, and for those who do, they mainly use it for checking to see who's online, chatting, spectating, and inviting them to games. This, in my opinion, is a good reason to have the chat be customisable to the individual user's preferences.

-Mastery page: In the old client, you could change mastery pages, mastery's themselves, and adding/removing pages much easier than you can in this one. Also, it seemed a bit cleaner with them all in a line, so you don't need to click and scroll. Maybe you could add the titles in a vertical line down the left side? Also i saw somewhere that it might be a good idea to implement a drag and drop system to customise where on the list each page appeared, for ease of access.

-Profile home page: I think this is mostly personal, but i loved the feature where you could rotate through the game modes and see your rank for each one. The main one being norms, mostly because it shows what rank you could get up to(i am lower rank in ranked than i am in norms-bronze/plat-) from where you currently are or were, kind of as a motivational thing.

-Rune page: No constructive criticism this time, just wanted to say i loved the feel of the new one

so ye i hope this helps
